onFocusChanged(android.view.View,java.la.Description: This method is called when the TextView that uses this TransformationMethod gains or loses focus.
onFocusChanged(android.view.View,java.la.FullName: public abstract void onFocusChanged (View view, CharSequence sourceText, boolean focused, int direction, Rect previouslyFocusedRect)

getTransformation(java.lang.CharSequence.Description: Returns a CharSequence that is a transformation of the source text -- for example, replacing each character with a dot in a password field. Beware that the returned text must be exactly the same length as the source text, and that if the source text is Editable, the returned text must mirror it dynamically instead of doing a one-time copy. The method should not return null unless source is null.
getTransformation(java.lang.CharSequence.FullName: public abstract CharSequence getTransformation (CharSequence source, View view)

ClassDesc: TextView uses TransformationMethods to do things like replacing the characters of passwords with dots, or keeping the newline characters from causing line breaks in single-line text fields.
